USA: George I of Great Britain died and was succeeded by George II of Great Britain.
Russia: Catherine established the Belgorod and Novgorod Governorates and adjusted the borders of several others. Districts were abolished; uyezds were reestablished.

According to Catherine's wishes the eleven-year-old Peter II, the son of Alexei Petrovich and grandson of Peter the Great, became tsar. The Supreme Privy Council was to hold power during his minority.
The conservative members of the Supreme Privy Council expelled its most powerful member, the liberal Menshikov.
Burma: Lan Na revolts; defeats Ava's attacks (1727–1728) and (1731–1732)
Brazil: Lt. Col. Francisco de Mello Palheta smuggles coffee seeds to Brazil in a bouquet, starting a coffee empire.
Belgium: Ostend Company petitions for the harbour of Ostend to be deepened.
